summary: The Gas Pipeline Leak Detection and Repair Act of 2025 aims to enforce a final rule from the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration regarding gas pipeline leak detection and repair. The bill makes the rule, issued January 17, 2025, effective upon enactment. It also allows the Secretary to update regulations with more stringent protections. The bill was introduced in the Senate on July 29, 2025, and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
